text: Is there a way to tell if a function was `@inline`’d?

elements.text: Is there a way to tell if a function was

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/is-there-a-way-to-tell-if-a-function-was-inline-d|to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
Best way I’m aware of is to `@code_typed` an outer function and see if the inner function disappears when you go from `optimize=false` to `true`.

elements.text: Best way I’m aware of is to
an outer function and see if the inner function disappears when you go from

text: Cthulhu can make this easier. You can turn off optimizations and descend until you see the function, and with them toggle optimizations on and off with a key `o`

elements.text: Cthulhu can make this easier. You can turn off optimizations and descend until you see the function, and with them toggle optimizations on and off with a key
